metadata.disclaimer: Based on publicly available crosswalks and expert analysis. Validate with qualified assessors for compliance/audit use.

clauses.title: An APRA-regulated entity must maintain an information security capability commensurate with the size and extent of threats to its information assets
clauses.rationale: PM-01 security program; PM-03 resources; PM-13 workforce; PM-09 risk strategy.
clauses.gaps: CPS 234 requires capability commensurate with threats. SP 800-53 covers security program but the proportionality/capability assessment concept is more explicit in CPS 234.

clauses.title: Board must ensure adequate maintenance of information security, senior management implement information security controls
clauses.rationale: PM-01 program plan; PM-02 senior security role.
clauses.gaps: CPS 234 places specific obligations on the Board and senior management. SP 800-53 assigns roles but Australian regulatory board accountability requirements need supplementation.

clauses.title: Clearly defined information security-related roles and responsibilities
clauses.rationale: PM-02 role assignment; PS-01/PS-02 personnel roles; PL-01 planning roles.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CPS 234 requires clear role definitions including for Board and senior management.

clauses.title: Maintain information security capability to manage information security vulnerabilities and threats commensurate with threats
clauses.rationale: PM-13 workforce; AT-02/AT-03 training; PM-03 resources; RA-05 vulnerability management; SI-02 remediation.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CPS 234 emphasizes capability maintenance commensurate with evolving threats. SP 800-53 covers through workforce and vulnerability management.

clauses.title: Information asset identification and classification
clauses.rationale: RA-02 security categorization; CM-08 component inventory; PM-05 system inventory.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CPS 234 requires identification of information assets including those managed by related parties and third parties.

clauses.title: Information security controls must protect information assets commensurate with criticality and sensitivity, and be subject to testing
clauses.rationale: AC family access controls; SC family communications protection; SI family integrity; AU family audit and accountability; CA-02 assessments; CA-08 penetration testing. SP 800-53 provides comprehensive security controls.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CPS 234 requires testing through control testing program. SP 800-53 CA family covers assessment/testing.

clauses.title: Testing by an independent party
clauses.rationale: CA-02(1) independent assessors; CA-08(1) independent penetration agent.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CPS 234 requires testing by independent specialists where warranted.

clauses.title: Notify APRA of material information security incidents
clauses.gaps: CPS 234 requires specific notification to APRA within 72 hours for material incidents and within 10 business days for control weaknesses. SP 800-53 IR-06 covers reporting but APRA-specific timelines are regulatory.

clauses.title: Notify APRA of material information security control weaknesses
clauses.rationale: CA-05 POA&M; IR-06 reporting; PM-04 plan of action tracking.
clauses.gaps: CPS 234 requires notifying APRA of control weaknesses that cannot be remediated in a timely manner. SP 800-53 tracks remediation but APRA-specific notification requirements are regulatory.

clauses.title: Internal audit review of information security controls
clauses.rationale: CA-02 security assessments with independent assessor; PM-06 performance measurement.
clauses.gaps: Minor: CPS 234 requires internal audit to review the design and operating effectiveness of information security controls. SP 800-53 covers assessment but internal audit specifics less detailed.

clauses.title: Related party and third party arrangements
clauses.rationale: SA-04 acquisition; SA-09 external services; SR family supply chain.
clauses.gaps: CPS 234 has specific requirements for related party and third party information security capability assessment. SP 800-53 covers vendor management but CPS 234-specific 'related party' concept and ongoing assessment requirements need supplementation.
